ngiemboon: Saẅi la gẅiin ngùʼ… á fʉ̀ʼ gie à la cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ, ńdeen ńké ésáʼ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngùʼ pʉ́a.
en: Saul was thirty years   old when he became king, and he reigned forty-two years  # 13:1 Text emended; MT reads two years over Israel.  # 13:1 Some LXX mss omit v. 1

ngiemboon: Saẅi la gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, ńtsɔ́ʼ palÿɔ́ʼncù ntsáʼ tá, pâ pʉ̀a ntsáʼ pʉ́a néŋe Migmásè, á shÿó mekwɛ́ Mbetɛɛ, míŋ we wembàŋa gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Jÿonataŋ pâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tàʼ ntsáʼ, é néŋe yɔ́b Ngimbeya á láʼ pà Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ. Saẅi tsẅi, apfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a piŋ né membʉ̀a mɔ́b.
en: He chose three thousand men from Israel for himself: two thousand were with Saul at Michmash   and in Bethel’s hill country, and one thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah  # 13:2 1Sm 10:26 of Benjamin. He sent the rest of the troops away, each to his own tent.

ngiemboon: Á tǎa ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, Jÿonataŋ zẅé ngúmnɔ̀ɔn pʉ̀a Filisi gẅie à la ne sáʼa pàga láʼ Ngemba, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Filisi gÿo ńzsé. Saẅi tóŋ ntaŋ tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ ntsèm, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pʉ̀a Ébɛ̀ júʼ!
en: Jonathan attacked the Philistine garrison  ,# 13:3 1Sm 10:5 in Gibeah,  # 13:3 LXX; MT reads Geba and the Philistines heard about it. So Saul blew the ram’s horn throughout the land  # 13:3 Jdg 3:27; 6:34 saying, “Let the Hebrews hear! ”  # 13:3 LXX reads “The slaves have revolted”,# 13:3 Nm 10:9; Jdg 3:27; 6:34

ngiemboon: Saẅi la zẅé ngúmnɔ̀ɔn pʉ̀a Filisi, á cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a Filisi ńgyáŋa lóŋ, ńtí pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, palÿɔ́ʼncù cúʼte nzèm Saẅi á Ngilengaa.
en: And all Israel heard the news, “Saul has attacked the Philistine garrison, and Israel is now repulsive to the Philistines.” Then the troops were summoned to join Saul at Gilgal.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Filisi la cúʼte yɔ́b lélÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ. Pɔ́ la gẅiin mekélêg ncù ntsáʼ móm tá ńgÿo pakwɔ́ʼ melÿóon ntsáʼ ntɔgɔ́, ńgÿo menùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù tà é gyɔ́ɔn páʼ sàŋasáŋa gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe máŋʉ́. Pɔ́ la tÿɔ́g lepumó sɔ́b á Migmásè, á na pàga sǎʼnèm ye Mbɛ́d-Aveŋ.
en: The Philistines also gathered to fight against Israel: three thousand   chariots, six thousand horsemen, and troops as numerous as the sand on the seashore.  # 13:5 Jos 11:4 They went up and camped at Michmash, east of Beth-aven.  # 13:5 LXX reads Michmash, opposite Beth-horon to the south,# 13:5 1Sm 14:23

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ la gyá, ḿmÿɔg tɛʼ, mélàʼmie mé la pú ńtíʼte pʉ̀a láʼ. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo pɔ́ lyeen tsɛ̀ɛ megÿɔ́b, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ mémbím menzóŋ, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ memvwɔ̀ʼ tóon, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ metɔ́ɔn, tà mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ megǒon.
en: The men of Israel saw that they were in trouble because the troops were in a difficult situation. They hid in caves, in thickets, among rocks, and in holes and cisterns.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a Ébɛ̀ la gíŋe ne ńtúmo ntse Juundʉŋ légʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ngâd pɔ́ wé Ngalad.
en: Some Hebrews even crossed the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead.

ngiemboon: À la zẅíʼte lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, tà ńkú fʉ̀ʼ gie Samîɛ la záb. Táʼ, Samîɛ te tóo Ngilengaa wɔ́, aláʼ leen ńké ńtága sa jʉʼ.
en: He waited seven days for the appointed time that Samuel had set,   but Samuel didn’t come to Gilgal, and the troops were deserting him.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Saẅi gɔɔn ngie: Pi lɔg pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, tà mbɔɔ we mbʉ́lè, ńtó ńnáa mbwó mèŋ. Kwàʼ yé leen ńké ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: So Saul said, “Bring me the burnt offering and the fellowship offerings.” Then he offered the burnt offering.

ngiemboon: À la nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, Samîɛ tó; Saẅi leen ńkẅɛ ńzáʼa yé, ńtsyɛʼte yé.
en: Just as he finished offering the burnt offering, Samuel arrived. So Saul went out to greet him,

ngiemboon: Samîɛ zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gÿǒ lêkɔ́? Saẅi tsɔ́ʼ ngie: N gyǎ palÿɔ́ʼ ncù cʉ́ʼʉ ne ésyeente syeente, mbà fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ ka zǎb ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo, á tɔ̌g, epʉ̀a Filisi piŋ ńnyé ńcúʼte Migmásè.
en: and Samuel asked, “What have you done? ”

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńkwaŋ yɔ́ɔn ngie: epʉ̀a Filisi ge sẅɛ́ʼ kẅɛ́te wɔ́ɔn á Ngilengaa, té gwɔ́ gie mèŋ sẅiŋté Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n kǎg tʉ̀ tà ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: I thought, ‘The Philistines will now descend on me at Gilgal, and I haven’t sought the Lord’s favor.’ So I forced myself to offer the burnt offering.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ ńgɔɔn mbwó Saẅi ngie: Ɔ̀ gÿǒ kwaʼ páʼ gʉ̀gʉ̀ la. Ɔ̀ kaa gÿo páʼ lepʉ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù, é ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́. Ɔ̀ gweʼe péʼe ńgÿo púʼu, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo, gù lâ ngẅɛ̀ jù zɔ láʼa sáʼa ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm!
en: Samuel said to Saul, “You have been foolish.   You have not kept the command the Lord your God gave you.  # 13:13 1Sm 15:22,28 It was at this time that the Lord would have permanently established your reign over Israel,  # 13:13 1Sm 1:22

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, lefùɔ shú téen ńgee néŋe wɔ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ně ńdáʼ ńtsɔ́ʼɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńkwoŋo páʼ à ge lɔgɔ yé gÿo fùɔ gẅie à ge sáʼ pʉ̀a pé, ńtí nue ɔ̀ kaa giŋ páʼ yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́.
en: but now your reign will not endure.   The Lord has found a man after his own heart,  # 13:14 Lit man according to his heart,# 13:14 1Sm 16:7; Ac 13:22 and the Lord has appointed him as ruler over his people, because you have not done what the Lord commanded.”

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ la kuʼ, Samîɛ fó Ngilengaa ńgʉa né Ngimbeya á jʉʼ gie ngẅɛ̀ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ ée wó. Saẅi la sáŋ menùɔ mie pâ pɔ̌ la gwɔ́: É gwɔ́ mbàŋa tà ńkuʼ mbɔɔ mmó nkÿo ntɔgɔ́.
en: Then Samuel went   from Gilgal to Gibeah in Benjamin. Saul registered the troops who were with him, about six hundred men.

ngiemboon: Saẅi pɔ́ míŋ we Jÿonataŋ, ńgÿo pfwɔ̀ʼɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pie pâ pɔ̌ la gwɔ́ la gʉa ńcúʼte Ngemba, á jʉʼ gie ngẅɛ̀ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ ée wó. Epʉ̀a pe ngwòŋ Filisi piŋ ńcúʼte yɔ́b á Migmásè.
en: Saul, his son Jonathan, and the troops who were with them were staying in Geba   of Benjamin, and the Philistines were camped at Michmash.

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù pie é tág jʉʼ tɛʼ la kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ mentàb ye pʉ̀a Filisi, éshʉ́a menùɔ méntá: Tàʼ nùɔ cʉ́me mánzsè légʉa né Ɔfela, á shÿó ngwòŋ Shuwaa;
en: Raiding parties   went out from the Philistine camp in three divisions. One division headed toward the Ophrah  # 13:17 Jos 18:23 road leading to the land of Shual.

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́ nùɔ la cʉ́me mánzsè légʉa né Mbɛ́d-Oloŋ; anùɔ ye nzèm cʉ́me mánzsè légʉa né ndège láʼ, á kwóŋ jʉʼʉ fúʼ gie áa Tsemboyim, á ngʉ̀ŋe kwòŋotsẅɛ.
en: The next division headed toward the Beth-horon   road, and the last division headed down the border road that looks out over the Zeboim Valley  # 13:18 Neh 11:34 toward the wilderness.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm, mé téen ńgyá táalɔ̀ɔn wɔ́. Mélàʼmie pʉ̀a Filisi la te ne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a Ébɛ̀ nyɛte nně ncù tà mbɔɔ lekwoŋ wɔ́!
en: No blacksmith could be found in all the land of Israel   because the Philistines had said, “Otherwise, the Hebrews will make swords or spears.”

ngiemboon: Awɛ̌wɛ̌ mámbàŋa Ésàlayɛ wɔ́ɔ la gẅiin légʉa mbʉ̀a táalɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa nyìŋ Filisi, ńtsege ye shú kélêg lɔg ńjʉ́ʼ ngwóŋ, ńtsege ye nzɔɔn, ńgÿo we tàʼsàgashú;
en: So all the Israelites went to the Philistines to sharpen their plows, mattocks, axes, and sickles.

ngiemboon: Nzẅìŋ lɔg ńtsege shú kélêg lɔg ńjʉ́ʼ ngwóŋ, mbɔɔ we tàʼsàgashú, é laa tàʼ pàga nkáb, nzẅìŋ we nzɔɔn, pɔ́ we lésiŋte twó lekwoŋ, é gíŋ ńgwɔ́ yé tàʼ pàga nkáb.
en: The price was two-thirds of a shekel   for plows and mattocks, and one-third of a shekel for pitchforks and axes, and for putting a point on a cattle prod.

ngiemboon: Á laa lyɛʼɛ́ lélÿɔ́ʼ ncù, epʉ̀a metsèm pie pâ Saẅi ńgÿo Jÿonataŋ la gwɔ́, pɔ́ te nně ncù gẅiin, ńké te lekwoŋ gẅiin; tà ńdíndàʼ Saẅi pɔ́ míŋ we Jÿonataŋ.
en: So on the day of battle not a sword or spear could be found in the hand of any of the troops who were with Saul   and Jonathan; only Saul and his son Jonathan had weapons.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ nùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pe Filisi la tó ńtyé na mánzsè we Migmásè.
en: Now a Philistine garrison   took control of the pass at Michmash.
